info.description: API to retrieve variety of information in relation to financial institutions such as the National Identifier (nationalId) codes, Legal Entity Identifier (LEI) details and Global Payment Initiative (GPI) participant details. LEIs are identification codes that enable consistent and accurate identification of all legal entities that are parties to financial transactions, including non-financial institutions
info.title: Swift Reference Data

get.summary: Retrieves the BIC code of the requested Bank's legal entity identifier
get.description: Retrieves the Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the requested Bank's legal entity identifier. The BIC is the SWIFT Address assigned to a bank in order to send automated payments to the banks concerned. It uniquely identifies the name and country of the bank and consists of 8-11 characters. Example format AAAABBCCDDD, where AAAA: 4 character bank code, BB: 2 character country code, CC: 2 character location code, DDD: optional 3 character branch code.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

get.summary: Retrieves the BIC or BICs for a given national ID with its country code or scheme.
get.description: Retrieves the Bank Identifier Code (BIC) or BICs for a given national ID with its country code or scheme. The BIC is the SWIFT Address assigned to a bank in order to send automated payments to the banks concerned. It uniquely identifies the name and country of the bank and consists of 8-11 characters. Example format AAAABBCCDDD, where AAAA: 4 character bank code, BB: 2 character country code, CC: 2 character location code, DDD: optional 3 character branch code.

parameters.name: countryId
parameters.description: ISO country code of the financial institution.

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: Represents the scheme (a synonym for the National ID type) under which the National ID is defined

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

get.summary: Retrieves national IDs for a BIC
get.description: Retrieves the national ID, the country code, and the code type for the specified Bank Identifier Code (BIC). If the BIC is linked to multiple national IDs, then multiple results can be returned. The BIC is the SWIFT Address assigned to a bank in order to send automated payments to the banks concerned. It uniquely identifies the name and country of the bank and consists of 8-11 characters. Example format AAAABBCCDDD, where AAAA: 4 character bank code, BB: 2 character country code, CC: 2 character location code, DDD: optional 3 character branch code.

parameters.name: bicId
parameters.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the Beneficiary bank.

parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

get.description: Retrieves the details of the participant from the Swift Global Payment Initiative (GPI) participant directory

parameters.name: participantId
parameters.description: Process Workflow Participant ID

parameters.name: countryId
parameters.description: ISO country code of the financial institution.

parameters.name: currencyCode
parameters.description: ISO Currency code, accepted in field 32A of incoming gpi MT 103 payment by the participant ID or by the gpi intermediary through which the participant can be reached for this currency

parameters.name: requestDate
parameters.description: Date on which the client's request to be classified as professional has been received.

parameters.name: channelType
parameters.description: Indicates the type of the Reachable Through channel

parameters.name: reachableThrough
parameters.description: Channel through which the participant is reachable for Global Payment Initiative (GPI) payment instructions for one of its GPI currencies

parameters.name: actAsIntermediary
parameters.description: Flag specifying whether the participant acts as the Global Payment Initiative (GPI) Intermediary Agent for GPI payments in a given currency and over a given REACHABLE THROUGH channel. Y indicates that the participant will forward incoming MT 103s payments coming from a GPI participant through this channel and in this currency to an upcoming GPI participant, per the GPI business rules.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The total number of records per page

parameters.name: page_start
parameters.description: The record from which the response should be displayed

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Unique id expected to get as part of response from t24 on every enquiry request.

parameters.name: credentials
parameters.description: Username and password to authenticate the API against core-banking.

parameters.name: companyId
parameters.description: The identifier of the underlying Entity/Company/Branch.

code.description: The identifier of the error message
The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message for bad requests

type.description: The identifier of error type: Business

code.description: The identifier of the error message

message.description: The actual t24 error message caused by server

type.description: The identifier of error type: System

bics.description: The BIC code of the Beneficiary bank

bicId.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the Beneficiary bank.

bicLocation1.description: Indicates first line of branch location of the financial institution

bicLocation2.description: Indicates second line of branch location of the financial institution

addressCity.description: The town and/or city component of the base address of a customer

postCode.description: Identifies the address postal code for the customer.

countryName.description: This is the country name that the financial institution resides in.

countryId.description: ISO country code of the financial institution.

nationalId.description: National identifier of the institution/branch. This field contains the National bank code for the financial institution (for example, BSC codes for UK banks)

scheme.description: Represents the scheme (a synonym for the National ID type) under which the National ID is defined

institutionName.description: Identifies the Financial Institution of BIC

branch.description: The branch information relevant to this BIC code.

officeType.description: Indicates the status of the entity in the office hierarchy e.g. Head Office, Main Payments Office

nationalId.description: National identifier of the institution/branch. This field contains the National bank code for the financial institution (for example, BSC codes for UK banks)

scheme.description: Represents the scheme (a synonym for the National ID type) under which the National ID is defined

bicId.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) of the Beneficiary bank.

nationalId.description: National identifier of the institution/branch. This field contains the National bank code for the financial institution (for example, BSC codes for UK banks)

scheme.description: Represents the scheme (a synonym for the National ID type) under which the National ID is defined

isNationalIdValid.description: Indicates whether the National Id is valid

idType.description: Specifies the type of the identifier used for the participant ID such as the BIC or NATIONAL.ID of a non-financial Payments Market Infrastructures (PMI)

participantName.description: Specifies the institution name of the participant

countryId.description: ISO country code of the financial institution.

currencyCode.description: ISO Currency code, accepted in field 32A of incoming gpi MT 103 payment by the participant ID or by the gpi intermediary through which the participant can be reached for this currency

cutOffTime.description: The Cut off time when all executions for the day are consolidated to create a trade

cutOffDay.description: Indicates the last day for Global Payment Initiative (GPI) payments in a given currency

localTimezone.description: Specifies the time zone of the participant

actAsIntermediary.description: Flag specifying whether the participant acts as the Global Payment Initiative (GPI) Intermediary Agent for GPI payments in a given currency and over a given REACHABLE THROUGH channel. Y indicates that the participant will forward incoming MT 103s payments coming from a GPI participant through this channel and in this currency to an upcoming GPI participant, per the GPI business rules.

reachableThrough.description: Channel through which the participant is reachable for Global Payment Initiative (GPI) payment instructions for one of its GPI currencies

channelType.description: Indicates the type of the Reachable Through channel

startDate.description: Contains the date on which the transaction or payment gets initiated.

stopDate.description: Indicates the date on which the Payment Stop is placed

ssiRecordKey.description: Record key of the Standing Settlement Instruction (SSI) in SWIFTRef's SSI Plus directory for this participant and currency. An SSI can list which correspondent bank and which account number at that correspondent bank to use to cover payments in a given currency directed to the participant or directed at the intermediary.

delegatedTo.description: Bank Identifier Code (BIC) which must take the action of forwarding the payment or updating the tracker on behalf of the participant ID.
